lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Bern.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Bern.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This class is where the main method resides.
* Method that runs the programme from an instance of Bern.
System.out.println("Hi! I'm Bern, your trustworthy chatbot.\nWhat can I do for you?");
* @param args Optional arguments that are passed to the main function.
DONE, DEADLINE, EVENT, TODO, BYE, LIST, DELETE, INVALID, FIND
* A parent class for all exceptions Bern(this programme) related.
* @param s The message passed to the instance of the exception.
* @param command The command whose description is empty.
super("the description of a " + command + " cannot be empty.");
* An exception for accessing index that is not valid.
* @param text The command that triggered the error.
super(text + ": This command is trying to mark/delete uncreated event");
* Exception for commands that are invalid.
* @param text The command that triggered the error.
super(text + " is not a command I understand");
* A class to contain all methods parsing related.
* A method to create a ToDo instance from a string command.
* @param s The command from which a ToDo instance will be made.
* A method to create a Deadline instance from a string command.
* @param s The command from which a Deadline instance will be made.
* A method to create an Event instance from a string command.
* @param s The command from which an Event instance will be made.
* A method to create a Task instance (can be Deadline, Event, or ToDo) from a string command.
* @param s The command from which a Task instance will be made.
* A method to check whether a given string can be parsed as a number (integer).
* @return A boolean to indicate whether it's a number or not.
* A method to check whether a command is of category "Done".
* @return Boolean whether the command is of category "Done".
* A method to check whether a command is of category "Deadline".
* @return Boolean whether the command is of category "Deadline".
* A method to check whether a command is of category "Event".
* @return Boolean whether the command is of category "Event".
* A method to check whether a command is of category "ToDO".
* @return Boolean whether the command is of category "ToDO".
* A method to check whether a command is of category "Delete".
* @return Boolean whether the command is of category "Delete".
* A method to check whether a command is "Bye".
* A method to check whether a command is "List".
* A class to encapsulates all methods storage/file related.
* A method to write into file from an ArrayList of Tasks.
* @param arListTask An ArrayList of Tasks to be written into a file.
* A method to initialise the ArrayList of Tasks.
* @param arListTask An ArrayList of Tasks to be initialised.
* A method to reinitialise the file (delete and make a new empty file).
* A class to encapsulates all methods TaskList related.
* A method to add task into an ArrayList of Tasks.
* @param arListTask The initial ArrayList of Tasks.
public void addTask(Task task, ArrayList<Task> arListTask) {
* A method to remove a task from an ArrayList of Tasks.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* @param arListTask The initial ArrayList of Tasks.
public void removeTask(int index, ArrayList<Task> arListTask) {
* A class to encapsulates all methods UI related.

return "Got it. I've added this task:\n"
+ (arListTask.size() == 1 ? " task in the list" : " tasks in the list");

ToDo temp = new Parser().toDoFromString("[T][ ] Do 2103 project");

String temp = new Ui().ifBye("hehe", new ArrayList<Task>());
assertEquals("Bye. Hope to see you soon and hope you found my service useful!", temp);
